Description: Papyrus (five fragments; two substantial, three very small). Of the two substantial pieces one is Greek and the other demotic. Both pieces are torn on both sides and at the top and bottom (although the Greek text may preserve its upper margin).The demotic piece has the very ends of 10 lines of one column and indeterminate traces of the beginnings of a second on the recto. On the verso there are isolated traces. The Greek text contains on the recto part of 10 lines of text (three lines, followed by a space, and then seven lines) and to the right of this traces (which may be demotic numbers). On the verso there are indistinct traces of ink. The Greek and demotic texts do not appear to be related.
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: cockled, delaminating, dirty, distorted, fractured Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: kraft paper Object Priority: B Mount Priority: B Overall Condition: C Curatorial condition comment: incomplete/fragmentary
